course_title: Early Years Curriculum and Pedagogical Foundations

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate understanding of core early years curricula and pedagogy concepts
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of young children and their learning
Design quality environments to foster creativity and curiosity in young children
Document childrens learning through detailed visual and text descriptions
Plan learning experiences based on young childrens interests to enhance young childrens learning
Critically analyse early years education literature and draw implications for early years learning environments and values for children's learning
Demonstrate an awareness of a range of strategies to engage parents and care givers as partners in the educative process

assessments.task_description:
Early Years Literature Reflection: Critical Reflection Response (Week 2 – 9)

The reflection is a response to the weekly course readings. After your weekly readings, write a reflection (up to 300 words) based on one reading, where you report the main ideas in the article, relate the ideas to your own experience, reason by showing why the ideas are important or the perspectives they provide, and reconstruct how this idea may be used by you in future professional experiences. All reflections will be submitted via the RiPPLE platform.

Before you complete the next weeks' reflection, moderate two of your peers' reflections by scoring and providing a written comment about the nature of their responses. Please comment on how your peer has interpreted what the article tells us about early years values, principles and pedagogy. For example, you may relate to their experience, report on something you may have taken from the same article to support them, or provide further reasoning for how their reflection extends upon ideas or constructs in the reading. No comments are to be made about how well written the reflection is.

You will receive 1.25 marks for your reflection submission and moderation of two peers' reflections each week. You need to score 3 or above in RiPPLE to receive a mark/grade. All reflections and peer feedback are monitored by the course coordinator. Any instances of unprofessional or unethical feedback will be overridden and/or removed by the course coordinator to ensure fair, collegial and professional responses as underscored in early years education.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload your weekly reflections to the UQ RiPPLE platform which can be accessed from the EDUC1760 Course Blackboard site in the 'Assessment' folder.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Practical/ Demonstration, Product/ Design
assessments.task_description:
Assessment 2: Learning Space Review and Design

In Week 3, you will be introduced to the importance of environments in early years education. We will examine photographs and videos taken of features at the Children’s Art Centre at GOMA, The Corner and The Reading Nook, at State Library Queensland, and in early years classrooms/settings, to explore children’s learning spaces. You will review one of these children’s spaces according to key early childhood concepts highlighted in the course.

You will consider the spaces from a child's perspective.

  • What aspects of the space design appeal to young children? How are they motivated to engage in the space?
  • What features would put them in direct conversation with the surrounding world?
  • How does the space allow the potential for children's continual exchange with the personal, cultural and social context to construct meaningful experiences to attribute sense, knowledge building and integrated understanding?

This assessment consists of three parts:

Review (up to 750 words):

Write a review of the one site that you focused on at either GOMA or State Library Queensland identifying evidence of application of the most pertinent key early childhood concepts highlighted in the course to the chosen space. Use the photographs and videos to explain the application of each concept. Support your review with references to course readings and wider literature on children’s spaces and early childhood education. Evaluate how the environment and the educators can attend to and engage children’s needs and interests, along with potential for constructing experiences which they are capable of attributing sense and meaning (Criteria 1).

Learning Space Plan:

Plan a learning space for an early years’ class to inspire wonder and facilitate co-constructed learning for one early years class group of children that engages personal, social and cultural experiences for a child. Use an online planning tool (such as floorplanner or roomsketcher). Label the design to highlight how you used ideas from the images and videos in your review to inform your own unique learning environment plan. (Criteria 2).

Learning Space Rationale (up to 750 words)

Provide a rationale of your plan - annotate each key feature of your plan noting your rationale of the pedagogical intent and practice for that feature of the learning space (drawing from course content with links to references). A distinct purpose in your learning space between materials, opportunities, and young children must be evident. Clear practical evidence linking to the United Nations Sustainability Goals must be provided in your plan and annotations.

You are required to integrate relevant references from the course readings and wider literature. Underneath your plan and annotations, describe and explain the educative purposes and goals and how you as a teacher could facilitate co-constructed learning with each element in the space you have designed. The plan will need to consider both interior and exterior space. Evidence of careful inclusion of design elements they provide interactive experiences in relation to the child and their surrounding reality. Evidence for careful inclusion of design elements to elicit a style of interactions in relation to the child and their surrounding reality is expected, even incorporating alternative educative approaches such as forest schools, needs in rural locations, inner city educational sites, or environments attached within workplaces.

All citations, referencing and formatting of the review and rationale are to be in APA 7th style.

There is no 10% leeway for the word count.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission via TurnitIn link in the EDUC1760 Blackboard site in the 'Assessment' folder.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Assessment 3: Group Collaboration/Presentation and Individual Documentation & Planning

In Week 9, you will be allocated to a group in your tutorial to collaborate for a presentation (in Weeks 10 and 11) about a learning episode video of early years children engaging in an activity. Individually, you will then create your own child-led project from the learning episode and submit this via TurnitIn in Week 13.

As part of the group component, you will:

  1. Document the potential development evidenced in the learning episode. In your documentation, integrate still images taken from the case study image as part of your annotation process.
  2. Write and present a running record commentary that depicts and articulates what the child/children can do/say/move/thinks/understand; any demonstrated interest; indication as to their sense of curiosity; potential for enriching the learning (use curricula and policy), any family/community/social/cultural considerations. This commentary should celebrate the learning and articulate the value of learning through referencing appropriate literature, identifying and explaining early years values and concepts explicitly, then justifying your documentation (tell the importance and purpose for documenting children's learning in the overall teaching and learning process). This running record is to be added as an appendix item in your individual written submission and does not count towards the word limit.
  3. During Week 10 and 11 tutorials, you will present your documentation/commentary as a group as an oral presentation (10 mins), where the students in the audience will provide some feedback on the presentation. Feedback will focus on how the documentation was achieved and possible learning sequences that will follow. The purpose of receiving feedback is to reflect on your plan to refine before assessment submission whilst also engaging in a collegial professional practice – a core value of early years education.

As part of the individual component, you will:

Plan a child-led project from the documented learning episode (approx. 1200 words).

  • Include a rationale, description of previous learning, intended learning objectives, at least 3 learning episodes to demonstrate the phases inherent in a project approach, pedagogical strategies (what the children and teacher will be doing in each phase), family/community links, intended outcomes, key questions, acknowledgement of individual learning considerations, relevant policies and ethical considerations.
  • Ensure that you include details on the environment (physical & social), teaching strategies, resources and address relevant (to observed context) curriculum statements or descriptions. Examples will be explored in lectures and tutorials are designed for you to practice identifying elements to include in a plan that considers pedagogy of place.
  • The plan must include enough detail so that another educator could implement the project using the plan.
  • All EDUC1760 course concepts are expected to be included in the plan.

All citations, referencing and formatting of the review and rationale are to be in APA 7th style.

There is no 10% leeway for the word count.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission via TurnitIn link in the EDUC1760 Blackboard site in the 'Assessment' folder.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
